ipxact:register.ipxact:name: MSTATUS
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: MSTATUS Register. This register controls the interrupt enabling and provides information about the trap context. U-mode and S-mode are supported in all the U and S mode of all the processors. The RPX-10x series, which are all RV64I cores, do not permit the SXL and UXL fields to be written. These fields always contain the value 2 (indicating SXLEN=64 and UXLEN=64 respectively). The processors support little-endian byte ordering only. Hence, the MBE, SBE and UBE bits are always read-only 0. An illegal instruction exception is raised if a WFI instruction is executed in any mode other than M-mode when TW=1. In effect, the timeout wait limit is implicitly 0. An illegal instruction exception is raised if a WFI instruction is executed in U-mode, regardless of the setting of the TW bit, if -rv_s_option is true. In processors configured without the F extension the FS field is read-only 0. In processors configured without the V extension the VS field is read-only 0.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: MSTATUSH
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: MSTATUSH Register. This register describes upper-half of the Machine-level status register.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: MNSTATUS
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: MNSTATUS Register. On entry to an RNMI trap handler the mnstatus CSR is updated with information from the interrupted context: The mnstatus.IP bit shadows the rnmi_a input signal and is read-only. Writes to mnstatus do not affect the value of the IP bit. The mnstatus.NMIE bit determines whether interrupts are enabled or disabled. On reset (including soft reset), the NMIE bit is set to 0, and in this state all interrupts are disabled - including RNMIs. When software is ready to accept RNMIs it sets NMIE to 1. This enables RNMIs and returns normal global control of maskable interrupts to mstatus.MIE. Software cannot clear the NMIE bit - once it has been set it remains set until an RNMI is taken, when the NMIE bit is cleared. The NMIE bit does not affect the operation of the WFI instruction. In order to minimize latency until the next RNMI is taken, software should follow the top-half/bottom-half model, where the RNMI handler itself only en-queues a task to handle the interrupt and then returns (or sets the NMIE bit to 1). The handler should acknowledge the source of the interrupt and wait until it detects mnstatus.IP is clear before returning. The bulk of the interrupt servicing is performed later, with RNMIs enabled. All other bits in mnstatus are reserved; software should write only zeros to those bits, and it will always return zeros when read by software. MNPP is set to the privilege mode prior to taking the RNMI trap. The encoding of this field is equivalent to the mstatus.MPP field. MNPV is set to the virtualization mode prior to taking the RNMI trap. The encoding of this bit is equivalent to the mstatus.MPV bit. NMIE is cleared.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: NMIE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Non-maskable interrupt enable (software settable, but not clearable):

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: MLWID
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: MLWID Register. This control register specifies the WID to be used in privilege levels lower than Machine mode, that is, (hypervisor extended) S, and when mwiddeleg equals zero - U, VS, and VU. The register can only be set with legal values, constrained by the rwiddeleg signal interpreted as a bitvector which encodes the allowed World IDs. If an illegal WID is written, the lowest-numbered legal WID is used instead. When wid_rwiddeleg is zero, the mlwid is not used but the root widvalue (wid_rlwid) is used instead. At reset the mlwid value is set to the value of the wid_rlwid signal at that time. The brackets around (hypervisor extended) denote an extended set of privilege modes when hypervisor is in operation. For example, without hypervisor it would be Supervisor mode (S) only, but with hypervisor it would include Hypervisor extended Supervisor mode (HS). WID_BITS = Ceiling(log 2(wid_num)) wid_num is the number of supported World IDs. WID_BITS is the number of bits required to express a WID value between 0 and wid_num.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: _HYPERVISOREXTENDED_SUPERVISORMODEWID
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: WID used in (Hypervisor extended) Supervisor mode when delegation is enabled

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: MWIDDELEG
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: MWIDDELEG Register. This register specifies which WIDs may be used in privilege levels lower than (Hypervisor extended) Supervisor, that is, U, VS, and VU. The value of this register is a bitvector restricting the set of WIDs that can be programmed into the hlwid, slwid and vslwid registers. The register can only be set with a subset of the root delegation, the wid_rwiddeleg signal. When mwiddeleg is zero, the delegation is disabled and hlwid, slwid , and vslwid are not used. At reset, the mwiddeleg value is set to zero. The brackets around (hypervisor extended) denote an extended set of privilege modes when hypervisor is in operation. For example, without hypervisor it would be Supervisor mode (S) only, but with hypervisor it would include Hypervisor extended Supervisor mode (HS). For non-static World ID configurations ( wid_mode = dynamic), all the WID CSRs determine the current WID used for external S/VS and U/VU mode transactions. WID_BITS = Ceiling(log 2(wid_num)) wid_num is the number of supported World IDs. WID_BITS is the number of bits required to express a WID value between 0 and wid_num.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: MWID
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Specifies the legal WID values for delegated setting in hlwid, slwid and vslwid

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: MISA
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: MISA Register. This read-only register is a standard CSR that reports partial information on the ISA supported by the core. The value defined for each bit field is given in .

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: X
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Indicates Non-standard extensions See The X bit [23] is set when APEX extensions are configured, or when any Synopsys proprietary extension to a standard feature is configured. This includes, for example, extensions to the Advanced Interrupt Architecture, and the extension to save/restore the virtualization context held in registers.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: C
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Indicates Compressed extension 0x1: Enabled This is enabled only when !(-rmx100_isa_mini_profile

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: V1
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: Enabled This is enabled only when !(-rmx100_isa_mini_profile)

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: B
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Reserved for B extension The processor supports the Zb* extensions rather than the earlier B extensions, and therefore the B bit in misa is always 0. The arcv_isa_opts_build register encodes the presence of each of the Zb* extensions individually.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: A
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Indicates Atomic extension 0x1: Enabled Configured by -rv_a_option

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: MISELECT
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: MISELECT Register. This register stores indirectly accessed CSR number within the Machine-level iCSR bank.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: MIREG
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: MIREG Register. This register stores the data of the indirectly accessed CSR which is referenced by miselect register. n in sireg denotes a range from 1 to 6.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: MTVEC
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: MTVEC Register. This register configures the M-mode trap handling. The -rtia_snvi option regulates implementation of Snvi extension and Nested Vectored interrupt handling mode. If Snvi extension is disabled (-rtia_snvi = false), then MTVEC.MODE[1:0] field has higher bit implemented as read-only zero (write to this bit is ignored). The Machine-mode trap handling configuration in this register does not impact interrupt handling for other privilege levels. Interrupt handling modes for other privileges can be configured independently.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: MODE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Trap handling mode. The field configures the interrupt handling mode when hart traps to M-mode. ARC-V interrupt architecture adds Nested Vectored interrupt handling mode in addition to the standard RISC-V Direct and Vectored modes.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: V0
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: Direct Mode. The TVEC field refers to the software handler which is common for all exceptions and major interrupts.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: V1
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: Vectored Mode. The TVEC field points to the vector table which is indexed by the major interrupt source number. Each interrupt vector consists of a 4-byte jump-to-immediate-address instruction that directs the processor to the appropriate interrupt handler. The entry with index 0 is dedicated to the handling of exception traps.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: V3
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: Nested Vectored Mode. The TVEC field points to the vector table which is indexed by external interrupt identity number. Each interrupt vector consists of a 4-byte address of interrupt handler. The entry with index 0 refers to the exception traps handler.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: MSCRATCH
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: MSCRATCH Register. This register preserves the pointer to software context, when hart executes the mode other than Machine. The software can use this register for any purpose.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: MEPC
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: MEPC Register. This register preserves the interrupt return address, which is equal to the address of the instruction that was next in progress at the time of the interrupt. Upon returning from an interrupt, the program counter value is copied from mepc. When an exception trap occurs, the mepc register may store the address of the instruction that caused the interrupt.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: MCAUSE
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: MCAUSE Register. This register stores information related to the type of exception or interrupt that is triggered, allowing for appropriate handling by software when necessary. The specific usage or ignoring of this information depends on the interrupt handling mode and how it is configured by the system.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: I
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Exception/Interrupt flag, if set to 1 then trap caused by interrupt request

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: CAUSE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Trap reason code (exception code or major interrupt number)

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: MNSCRATCH
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: MNSCRATCH Register. This register enables the NMI trap handler to save and restore the context that was interrupted.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: MNSCRATCH
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Stores the NMI trap handler value

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: MNEPC
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: MNEPC Register. This register holds the PC values of the instruction that took the interrupt, upon entry to the NMI trap handler. This is a WARL register that can represent all valid PC values. The mnepc[0] is always zero.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: MNCAUSE
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: MNCAUSE Register. This register contains the reason for the NMI in bits MXLEN-2:0, with bit MXLEN-1 set to 1, upon entry to an RNMI interrupt or exception.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: EXCEPTION_CODE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Indicates the cause of the RNMI

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: MTVAL
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: MTVAL Register. This register stores machine trap values.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: MVENDORID
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: MVENDORID Register. This is a 32-bit read-only register that contains the JEDEC manufacturer ID for Synopsys processor IP cores.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: MARCHID
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: MARCHID Register. This is a (M-mode XLEN value) MXLEN-bit read-only register encoding the base micro-architecture of the core. The RISC-V privileged architecture standard requires that the most-significant bit is always 1. The remaining MXLEN-1 bits encode the marketing product name of the core, which are unique across all ARC-V products. This register encodes equivalent information to the ARCVER field in the IDENTITY register of Classic ARC cores. All ARC-V cores use the least significant 8 bits of marchid to encode the product family, according to the list of options shown in The bits [10:8] encodes the sub-product options, which for the core specify the multi-core, vector processing, and FuSa product options.The marchid CSR value for the core is 0x80000042 .

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: MIMPID
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: MIMPID Register. This is an MXLEN-bit read-only register encoding version information for the processor implementation. The value of this register for the RHX family of processors is 0x00020100.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: PRODUCT
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Encodes product family, as recognized by the TCF tool

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: V1
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: Current version for ARC-V RMX processors

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: V2
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: Current version for ARC-V RHX processors

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: V3
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: Current version for ARC-V RPX-10x processors

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: V4
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: Current version for ARC-V RPX-50x processors

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: MINOR_REV
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Minor (or patch) revision of the product

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: MHARTID
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: MHARTID Register. This is an MXLEN-bit read-only register encoding the identity of the core that reads this register. The value of this register is provided by the tie-off input port arcnum. In a multi-core configuration, the arcnum input port is replicated for each core and the port names are prefixed with cN, where N is unique for each core and in the range 0..num_cores-1. Each core has an 8-bit input signal port arcnum[7:0] that the enclosing SoC can drive to give each hart a unique identifier. The value presented on the arcnum port will be returned to software when the mhartid register is read. To comply with the RISC-V privileged architecture there must be at least one core with an ID of zero, and this requires that -arc_num of one CPUisle is set to 0, and that when the archipelago is instantiated in the SoC, one of the arcnum ports is driven with the value 0.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: MTSP
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: MTSP Register. The mtsp is M-mode MXLEN-bit read/write register, that can preserve the SP (software stack pointer) register value of the lower privilege level when hart handles the M-mode exception/interrupt. This register is defined by proprietary ARC-V trap stack pointer (Stsp) extension. When menvcfg.MTSP bit is set, the hart automatically swaps the SP register and arcv_mtsp register in the following cases: The formal description of exception stack pointer management, when hart enters M-mode exception/interrupt or executes mret privileged instruction is as follows: Hart enters M-mode from lower privilege execution level to handle M-mode exception/interrupt. Hart executes an mret instruction and returns to a lower privilege execution mode. // Check if automatic SP management enabled if (menvcfg.MTSP == 0x1) // Check if previous privilege mode is not Machine if (mstatus.MPP != 0x3) // perform swap of SP and mtsp swap(mtsp, SP) else // Previous privilege mode is M-mode => do nothing else // Automatic SP management is disabled => do nothing The -rtia_stsp option controls the Stsp extension support. When -rtia_stsp = false, then MTSP and menvcfg.MTSP flag is implemented as read-only zero.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: MENVCFG
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: MENVCFG Register. This register defines the lower-half of the Machine-level environment configuration bits. If Supervisor or User privilege mode is implemented in addition to Machine privilege mode, then Stsp extension implements the MTSP flag in the menvcfg register. If both Supervisor and User modes are implemented, then Stsp extension requires additional STSP flag to be allocated in menvcfg register. Except for MTSP and STSP flags, the other fields in the Machine-level environment configuration register are defined by the f_1_risc_v_references.ditaRISC-V Instruction Set Manual Volume 2, Version 20211203, Revised 20231023, Sep 2023.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: MTSP
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Machine-level Trap Stack Pointer Management; configured by option -rtia_stsp

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: MENVCFGH
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: MENVCFGH Register. This register defines the upper-half of the Machine-level environment configuration bits. If Supervisor or User privilege mode is implemented in addition to Machine privilege mode, then Stsp extension implements the MTSP flag in the menvcfg register. If both Supervisor and User modes are implemented, then Stsp extension requires additional STSP flag to be allocated in menvcfg register.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: STCE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Supervisor-level time-compare enable, enables the S-mode time compare device and the local interrupt source associated to it; Configured by option -rtia_sstc

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: TIME
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: TIME Register. This register describes lower-half bits of user-level time register. It also acts as a Timer for RDTIME instruction. If the mcounteren.TM = 0 , then access to the time imeh is disabled. Attempt to read (including RDTIME instruction) the (time imeh ) CSR causes illegal instruction exception.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: TIMEH
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: TIMEH Register. This register describes upper-half bits of user-level time register. If the mcounteren.TM = 0, then access to the time/timeh is disabled. Attempt to read (including `RDTIME` instruction) the (time/timeh) CSR causes illegal instruction exception.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: MECC_DIAGNOSTIC
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: MECC_DIAGNOSTIC Register. This register describes the ECC Status and Diagnostic information.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: I
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: This field records whether the ECC or parity exception is generated for an instruction or data access.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: ECC_RAM_ID
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: This field records the memory responsible for generating the ECC or parity exception. All other values are Reserved

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: P
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: This field indicates whether an ECC or parity exception is precise. When an instruction with the ECC exception is allowed to commit, the P field is set to 1 and an interrupt is generated

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: ECC_CODE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: This field records the ECC code on ECC or parity error exceptions. This field is also used when the software access to the ECC code is enabled to read or write the ECC code.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: MCACHE_CTL
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: MCACHE_CTL Register. This register is used to program the cache behavior. This includes level-1 instruction cache This includes level-1 instruction cache The control bits for each cache are in a separate byte of this register; if a particular cache is not implemented in the core, then the corresponding byte in arcv_mcache_ctl is a WARL field whose value is always 0. The arcv_mcache_ctl register is always implemented; if a core does not have any caches, then the entire register returns 0 when read and all writes to it are ignored. , data cache,and level-0 data cache (critical pointer cache), and level-2 unified cache. , data cache and level-0 data cache (critical pointer cache), and level-2 unified cache. A write of zero to the cache enable bits ( IC_ENDC_ENL2_EN) does not trigger an invalidation cache maintenance operation. As such, caches are explicitly invalidated using cache maintenance operations before they are disabled by software. , , In configuration without ECC, the IC_ECC_CTL and IC_ECC_RW fields are reserved.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: V1
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: The register is only accessible in machine and supervisor modePARA This register is enabled only when the Supervisor mode is configured.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: IC_ECC_RW
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Enables or disables write access to the stored ECC bits from the instruction cache maintenance operations:

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: IC_ECC_CTL
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Controls the ECC behavior for the instruction cache

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: V1
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: Raise an exception on uncorrectable error

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: V2
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: Raise an exception on detection of any error

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: V3
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: Reserved value, writing this value will write 0

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: IC_EN
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Enables or disables the instruction cache:

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: MCACHE_OP
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: MCACHE_OP Register. A write to this CSR triggers a cache maintenance operation defined by the value written in the CSR. A write to bits[23:0] of this register triggers a cache maintenance operation defined by the value written in the CSR. The table below specifies the encoding for all available cache management operations.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: IS
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Status of instruction cache maintenance operation. This bit is asserted by hardware when an instruction cache maintenance (for example: Instruction cache locking) is in progress. This is a read-only bit.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: MCACHE_ADDR
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: MCACHE_ADDR Register. For address-based operations, this CSR defines the address that will be looked-up in the cache. The address granularity for these operations is one cache line. For region-based operations, this register defines the start address of the operation. For index-based operations, this CSR defines the {line offset, set index, way} as described in . is an example of the layout of the arcv_mcache_addr register for an index based operation, assuming a 32KB cache, 64-byte line size, and 2-way set-associative.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: SET_INDEX
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: B = A + log(cache size/cache ways*cache line size) 2

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: MCACHE_LINES
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: MCACHE_LINES Register. For region-based maintenance operations, this CSR defines the address range in terms of cache lines. As an example, if one wants to invalidate a 4 KB address range and the cache line is 64 Bytes, the value written in this CSR should be 64 (4 KB/64). If arcv_mcache_lines is zero, the address based operation target a single line specified in arcv_mcache_addr .

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: MCACHE_DATA
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: MCACHE_DATA Register. This register is used for index-based cache operations. It provides the data to be written into the cache ( I_IDX_WRITE_DATA, I_IDX_WRITE_TAG) and holds the data read from the cache (I_IDX_READ_DATA, I_IDX_READ_TAG). The layout of the register depends on the cache management operation. is an example of the layout of the arcv_mcache_data register for I_IDX_WRITE_TAG, I_IDX_READ_TAG, assuming a 32KB cache When reading or writing cache data memories using index-based cache maintenance operations, the arcv_mcache_data register contains a word-sized data value to be written or read. When reading or writing cache tag memories using index-based cache maintenance operations, the arcv_mcache_data register contains a tag value to be written or read. s, 64-byte line size, and 2-way set-associative.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: ARCV_ICACHE_BUILD
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: ARCV_ICACHE_BUILD Register. This register indicates the version number of the first-level private instruction cache of the processor, along with the configuration of the cache itself. In all cases, any non-enumerated values are reserved.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: D
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Set to 1 if the I-cache is disabled on reset, otherwise 0.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: VERSION
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Indicates the version of the L1 Instruction Cache (always non-zero if included) 0x1 : Current Versio

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: ARCV_ICCM_BUILD
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: ARCV_ICCM_BUILD Register. This register describes the size and version number of the Instruction Closely Coupled Memory (ICCM). In all cases, any non-enumerated values are reserved.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: ICCM1_SIZE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Capacity of ICCM1, using the same encodings as ICCM0_Size.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: VERSION
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Provides the version of the ICCM (always non-zero if ICCM0 and/or ICCM1 is included) 0x1 : Current Versio

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: ARCV_BCR_BUILD
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: ARCV_BCR_BUILD Register. This register specifies which build configuration register implementation is present.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: VERSION
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Indicates the version of the BCR implementation (always non-zero) 0x1 : BCRs located in the CSR address range 0xFC0 to 0xFE

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: V1
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: BCRs located in the CSR address range 0xFC0 to 0xFEF

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: ARCV_MSFTY_BUILD
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: ARCV_MSFTY_BUILD Register. The register describes the safety configuration.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: HEI
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Indicates if Hardware Error Injection is configured.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: V0
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: Hardware support for latent checks is not configured

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: V1
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: Hardware support for latent checks is configured

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: SBE_DPT
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Indicates single-bit error address syndrome register depth. This field is configured through -sbe_addr_depth option. All non-enumerated values are reserved.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: ARCV_PMP_BUILD
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: ARCV_PMP_BUILD Register. This register indicates the current PMP configuration information. In all cases, any non-enumerated values are reserved.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: S
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Indicates sPMP support. Set to 1 if the processor supports the sPMP extension.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: VERSION
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Indicates the version of PMP (always non-zero if PMP is included)

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: ARCV_PMA_BUILD
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: ARCV_PMA_BUILD Register. This register indicates the current PMA configuration information. In all cases, any non-enumerated values are reserved.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: REGIONS
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Indicates the number of supported PMA regions.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: VERSION
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Indicates the version of PMA (always non-zero if PMA is included).

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: ARCV_SEC_BUILD
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: ARCV_SEC_BUILD Register. This register describes the security build configurations.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: FIXED_WID
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: WID of core 0 when wid_mode is static (indicated by M field clear)

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: NUM_WIDS
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: The number of different World IDs supported.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: VERSION
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Provides version of security (always non-zero if security is included)

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: ARCV_TIMER_BUILD
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: ARCV_TIMER_BUILD Register. The register indicates the presence of the processor timer's auxiliary registers.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: BASE_ADDRESS
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Base address of memory-mapped timer registers, excluding lower 12 bits (all assumed to be zero).

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: ARCV_CLINT_BUILD
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: ARCV_CLINT_BUILD Register. This register describes the information about core local interrupter features configured at design time.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: VERSION
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Indicates ARC-V Clint build version 0x1 : Current Version

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: V0
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: Major interrupt priorities are not implemented

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: SSTC
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Supervisor level and virtual supervisor level timer device

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: ARCV_IMSIC_BUILD
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: ARCV_IMSIC_BUILD Register. This register describes the information about incoming MSI controller features configured at design time.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: VERSION
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Indicates ARC-V IMSIC build version 0x1 : Current Version

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: V0
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: External interrupt delivery is not implemented

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: V3
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: Both MSI and DMSI delivery implemented Note: Bit #3 and #2 are reserved in EIDLV field

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: GIFNUM
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Number of virtual guest interrupt files All non-enumerated values are reserved.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: GIFSZ
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Virtual guest interrupt file size All non-enumerated values are reserved.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: SIFSZ
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Supervisor interrupt file size All non-enumerated values are reserved.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: MIFSZ
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Machine interrupt file size All non-enumerated values are reserved.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: ARCV_TRIGGERS_BUILD
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: ARCV_TRIGGERS_BUILD Register. This register describes the trigger information. In all cases, any non-enumerated values are reserved.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: VERSION
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Provides the Trigger Version (always non-zero if triggers are included)

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: ARCV_MMIO_BUILD
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: ARCV_MMIO_BUILD Register. This register defines the base address in memory for all memory mapped I/O (MMIO) registers that are implemented in the processor.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: MMIO_BASE_ADDR_31_20_
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: This register contains bits [31:20] of the base address of the MMIO region. The lower bits of the MMIO base address are always 0 and are therefore not represented in this register.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: ARCV_ISA_OPTS_BUILD
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: ARCV_ISA_OPTS_BUILD Register. This register describes the ISA options for the processor. This revised version works in conjunction with the misa register, requiring that A, C, E, M and S are appropriately set to reflect the core configuration of the extensions covered by those bits in the misa register.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: ISA_OPTIONS
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Set to 1 if the Zic64rs extension is supported.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: VERSION
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Indicates the version of the ISA options:

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: ARCV_DCCM_BUILD
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: ARCV_DCCM_BUILD Register. This register describes the size and version number of the Data Closely Coupled Memory (DCCM). In all cases, any non-enumerated values are reserved.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: V2
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: Two-cycle memory; always includes four banks

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: VERSION
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Indicates version of the DCCM (always non-zero if DCCM is included)

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: ARCV_DMP_PER_BUILD
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: ARCV_DMP_PER_BUILD Register. This register describes the size and version for the private peripheral interface. In all cases, any non-enumerated values are reserved.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: PER0_SIZE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Size of the private peripheral interface (in MB)

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: VERSION
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Private Peripheral Interface Version (always non-zero if included)

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: ARCV_RAS_BUILD
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: ARCV_RAS_BUILD Register. This register describes memory ECC protection. In all cases, any non-enumerated values are reserved.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: ICP
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Protection applied to L1 Instruction Cache

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: V2
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: ECC protection on data and address

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: V2
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: ECC protection on data and address

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: V2
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: ECC protection on data and address

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: VERSION
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Indicates RAS Version (always non-zero if included)

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: DCSR
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: DCSR Register. This register provides additional information about the core's state upon entering the debug mode and allows the external debugger control core's debug behavior more precisely. Although this register is in CSR space, it can be read or written from the debug mode only.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: VHF
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: There is debug support, but it does not conform to any available version of this specifications.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: V0
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: The hart entered a critical error state

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: CETRIG
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Determines the behavior of a hart in a critical-error state

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: V0
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: This denotes exception. ebreak instructions in M-mode behave as described in the Privileged Specification.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: V1
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: ebreak instructions in M-mode enter Debug Mode.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: V0
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: This denotes exception. ebreak instructions in U-mode behave as described in the Privileged Specification.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: V1
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: ebreak instructions in U-mode enter Debug Mode.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: V0
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: Interrupts (including NMI) are disabled during single stepping with dcsr.step set.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: V1
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: Interrupts (including NMI) are enabled during single stepping with dcsr.step set.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: CAUSE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Explains why Debug Mode was entered.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: V2
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: A Trigger Module trigger fired with action=1.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: V3
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: The debugger requested entry to Debug Mode using dmcontrol.haltreq.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: V4
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: The hart single stepped because dcsr.step was set.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: V5
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: The hart halted because resethaltreq bit is set.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: V0
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: mstatus.mprv in mstatus is ignored in Debug Mode.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: V1
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: mstatus.mprv in mstatus takes effect in Debug Mode.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: NMIP
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: When set, there is a Non-Maskable-Interrupt (NMI) pending for the hart.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: STEP
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: When set and hart is in Debug Mode, the hart will execute a single instruction and then enter Debug Mode again. The debugger must not change the value of this bit while the hart is running

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: PRV
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Contains the privilege mode the hart was operating in when Debug Mode was entered.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: DPC
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: DPC Register. This register contains the virtual address of the next instruction to be executed upon exiting the debug mode. Upon entering the debug mode, the value of this register is set in such a way that if debugger resumes the core without changing dpc, the control flow remains the same as if debug mode was not entered. Execution of the program buffer does not change the value of this register unless one of instructions in the program buffer does it explicitly.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: DPC
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: It contains the virtual address of the next instruction to be executed upon exiting the debug mode.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: ARCV_DBG_CTRL
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: ARCV_DBG_CTRL Register. This register provides the capability for an external debugger to select the privilege mode used when accessing indirect registers with abstract commands. It also provides a capability to initiate a soft reset. Although this register is in CSR space, it can be read and written only from the debug mode. The correct 6-bit pattern must be written to SOFT_RESET to initiate a soft reset. This reduces the probability of an erroneous write causing a soft reset, compared to writing just a single bit.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: SOFT_RESET
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Writing 101010 to the soft_reset field will initiate a soft reset. This field always reads as zero, as it is cleared by both soft and hard reset.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: MODE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Effective privilege mode to use when performing iCSR read/write abstract commands.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: ARCV_SR_EPC
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: ARCV_SR_EPC Register. After a soft reset, the arcv_sr_epc register contains the value of PC, at the time soft reset was initiated. The format of this register is same as that of mepc .

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: SR_EPC
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: the value of PC, at the time soft reset was initiated

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: ARCV_SR_MSTATUS
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: ARCV_SR_MSTATUS Register. After a soft reset, the arcv_sr_mstatus register contains the value of the mstatus register, at the time soft reset was initiated. The format of this register is same as that of mstatus .

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: SR_MSTATUS
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: the value of mstatus register, at the time soft reset was initiated

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: ARCV_SR_MSTATUSH
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: ARCV_SR_MSTATUSH Register. After a soft reset, thearcv_sr_mtatush register contains the value of the mstatush register at the time soft reset is initiated. The format of this register is same as that of mstatush .

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: SR_MSTATUSH
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: the value of mstatush register, at the time soft reset was initiated

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: ARCV_SR_XSTATE
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: ARCV_SR_XSTATE Register. The contents of an internal core state is saved to this resister upon a soft reset. The saved state is defined as shown in .

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: MCAUSE_5_0_
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: This field contains the value of the lowe, 6 bits of the mcause register, at the time soft reset was initiated

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: V
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: This fields contains the value of the virtualization mode when soft reset was applied.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: PRV
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: This field contains the standard encoding of the nominal privilege mode in operation when soft reset was applied.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: FR
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: This bit is set if there was a pending floating-point unit retirement when soft reset was applied.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: CR
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: This bit is set if there was a pending core register retirement when soft reset was applied.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: EXL
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: This bit is set if the execution unit was actively processing instructions, when soft reset was applied.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: FPL
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: This bit is set if there was a floating-point instruction in progress when soft reset was applied.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: DIV
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: This bit is set if there was an integer divide/remainder instruction in progress, when soft reset was applied.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: PTW
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: This bit is set if there was a PTW in progress when soft reset was applied.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: PF
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: This bit is set if there was an outstanding (read) prefetch transaction when soft reset was applied.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: LSP
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: This bit is set if there was an outstanding transaction to the private peripheral memory bus when soft reset was applied.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: LSC
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: This bit is set if there was an outstanding cached load/store memory transactions when soft reset was applied.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: LSU
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: This bit is set if there was an outstanding uncached load/store memory transaction when soft reset was applied.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: IFU
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: This bit is set if there was an outstanding instruction fetch memory transaction, when soft reset was applied.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: SR
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: This bit is set when a soft reset is initiated, and can be used by boot software to distinguish between hard and soft reset situations.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: MICCM_CTL

If ICCMarcv_miccm_ctl register will read as zero and writes to all bits will be ignored. n not included in a build configuration, the corresponding fields ICCMn_Base, Dn, Rn and En will read as zero and writes to those fields will be ignored. In the absence of any ICCM, the entire

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: ICCM1_BASE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: This describes the base address of ICCM1.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: D1
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Disable ICCM1. Setting this bit to 1 disables access to the ICCM1 but retains the state of ICCM1

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: R1
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: RWECC bit for ICCM1. This field controls whether software can access the ECC code (syndrome) stored in memory. This could be used to inject ECC errors in the ICCM.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: Disable software access to ECC code

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: Enable software access to ECC code

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: E1
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: ECCEN bits for ICCM1. This bit shows Protection (ECC/parity) error control for the ICCM0.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: Generate exceptions on uncorrectable ECC/parity error

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: V2
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: Generate exceptions on any type of parity/ECC error (including single-bit ECC error)

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: D0
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Disable ICCM Setting this bit to 1 disables access to the ICCM but retains the state of ICCM

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: R0
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: RWECC bit for ICCM0. This field controls whether software can access the ECC code (syndrome) stored in memory. This could be used to inject ECC errors in the ICCM.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: V0
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: Disable software access to ECC code

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: V1
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: Enable software access to ECC code

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: E0
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: ECCEN bits for ICCM0. This bit shows Protection (ECC/parity) error control for the ICCM0.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: V1
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: Generate exceptions on uncorrectable ECC/parity error

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: V2
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: Generate exceptions on any type of parity/ECC error (including single-bit ECC error)

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: MIE
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: MIE Register. This register shows lower-half of the Machine-level interrupt-enable bits. The ARC-V hart conforms to the standard portion of Machine-level major interrupt sources defined by the f_1_risc_v_references.ditaRISC-V Instruction Set Manual Volume 1, Version 20191213, Revised 20230723, Jul 2023 and f_1_risc_v_references.ditaRISC-V Advanced Interrupt Architecture, Version 1.0.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: MEI
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Machine-level external interrupt-enable; configured by option -rtia_imsic_m_mode_file

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: SEI
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Supervisor-level external interrupt-enable; configured by option -rtia_imsic_s_mode_file

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: STI
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Supervisor-level timer interrupt-enable; configured by option -rtia_sstc

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: SSI
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Supervisor-level software interrupt-enable; configured by option -rtia_sswi

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: MIEH
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: MIEH Register. This register shows upper-half of the Machine-level interrupt-enable bits. The ARC-V hart conforms to the standard portion of Machine-level major interrupt sources defined by the f_1_risc_v_references.ditaRISC-V Instruction Set Manual Volume 1, Version 20191213, Revised 20230723, Jul 2023 and f_1_risc_v_references.ditaRISC-V Advanced Interrupt Architecture, Version 1.0. If the interrupt-enable bit is set to 0, the corresponding local interrupt source remains inactive within the hart. The interrupt-enable bit state does not affect corresponding interrupt-pending bit in mip or miph. The interrupt source can set the interrupt-pending bit even the corresponding interrupt-enable is zero. However, if not enabled, the interrupt pending bit will not be shown at lower privileges even the delegation is allowed and configured in mideleg or midelegh.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: MIP
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: MIP Register. This register shows lower-half of the Machine-level interrupt-pending bits. The registers contain pending bits for S-mode local interrupts and correspond to the implemented bits of the sie and sieh registers.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: GEI
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Hypervisor guest external interrupt-pending; configured by option -rtia_imsic_v_mode_file

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: MEI
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Machine-level external interrupt-pending; configured by option -rtia_imsic_m_mode_file

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: VEI
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: VS-level external interrupt-pending; configured by option -rtia_imsic_v_mode_file

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: SEI
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Supervisor-level external interrupt-pending; configured by option -rtia_imsic_s_mode_file

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: VTI
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: VS-level timer interrupt-pending; configured by option -rtia_sstc

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: STI
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Supervisor-level timer interrupt-pending; configured by option -rtia_sstc

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: SSI
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Supervisor-level software interrupt-pending; configured by option -rtia_sswi

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: MIPH
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: MIPH Register. This register implements upper-half of the Machine-level interrupt-pending bits.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: MTOPEI
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: MTOPEI Register. This register is the interface to the Machine-level IMSIC interrupt file. It reports the top priority pending-and-enabled external interrupt information to the hart.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: MTOPI
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: MTOPI Register. This register acts as an interface to the Core Local Interrupt controller (CLINT). It reports the machine-level top priority pending-and-enabled major interrupt information to the hart. The mtopi.IPRIO field reports the priority configured in the iprio array for the highest priority pending-and-enabled major interrupt. If an external interrupt is pending, the mtopi.IPRIO reflects the top pending-and-enabled external interrupt priority as provided by the external interrupt controller (such as IMSIC). IPRIOiprio#K.PRIO-rtia_imsic_m_file_size In case of major interrupts with default priorities (corresponding iprio#K.PRIO[#N] field is set to 0) is pending, the mtopi.IPRIO field reports the value as follows: When reading from the mtopi, it is important to note that this operation does not influence the state of the interrupt-pending bit in the mip or miph. For edge-triggered major interrupts, the software interrupt handler must explicitly clear the interrupt-pending bit by setting it to zero in the mip or miph. In contrast, for level-triggered major interrupts, the interrupt-pending bit in the mip or miph is read-only and should be cleared by ensuring that the interrupt request originator de-asserts the interrupt request signal. The width of the field is equal to the width of field and depends on number of external interrupts (the size of M-mode IMSIC interrupt file defined by configuration option). If the major interrupt default priority is higher than Machine level external interrupt default priority, then mtopi.IPRIO = 0. If the major interrupt default priority is lower than Machine level external interrupt default priority, then mtopi.IPRIO = 255. A read of mtopi register returns zero if no enabled major interrupts are pending. If the design omits the M-mode interrupt file, the external interrupt controller (other than IMSIC) must report the highest pending-and-enabled external interrupt priority. If the external interrupt controller does not support direct reporting of the pending interrupt's priority, the mtopi.IPRIO field width is equal to 6 bits and the major external interrupt priority field in the iprio iCSRs should be writable.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: MDCCM_CTL
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: MDCCM_CTL Register. This register describes the base address, software access to ECC code and ECC/parity error control of the DCCM. After reset the DCCM_base field is set to the default base addresses for DCCM if DCCM is included in the core. The default base address is defined at build-time by the -dccm_base option. The R and D fields contain 0x0 after reset, and E contains 0x1 after reset.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: DCCM_BASE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: This describes the base address of DCCM.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: D
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Disable DCCM Setting this bit to 1 disables access to the DCCM. The contents of DCCM is retained when it is disabled.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: R
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: RWECC bit for DCCM. This field controls whether software can access the ECC code (syndrome) stored in memory. This could be used to inject ECC errors in the DCCM.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: V0
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: Disable software access to ECC code

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: V1
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: Enable software access to ECC code

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: E
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: ECCEN bit for DCCM. These bits control Protection (ECC/parity) error control for the DCCM.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: V1
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: Generate exceptions on uncorrectable ECC/parity error

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: V2
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: Generate exceptions on any type of parity/ECC error (including single-bit ECC error)

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: ARCV_PER0_BASE
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: ARCV_PER0_BASE Register. This register defines the base address of the private peripheral aperture.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: PER0_BASE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: The base address is aligned on a 1 MB boundary.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: ARCV_PER0_SIZE
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: ARCV_PER0_SIZE Register. This register defines the size of the private peripheral aperture.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: PER0_SIZE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: The size of the private peripheral aperture is specified in integer multiples of 1 MB. Note: The private peripheral aperture range is defined as: PER_BASE <= PER aperture < PER + SIZE .

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: MSEC_CFG_HI
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: MSEC_CFG_HI Register. Higher part of machine security configuration

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: MSEC_CFG_LO
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: MSEC_CFG_LO Register. Lower-half of machine security configuration.
