ipxact:register.ipxact:description: PMA_CFG0 Register. These registers holds the configurations for the eight PMA entries, as shown in and . The layout of each 8-bit configuration field is as shown in . For more information about memory attributes, see ../concepts/memory_attributes_2.dita. n = n represents 0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7. Encoding of Memory Attributes pmancfg[4:1] Memory Attributes 0000 Device non-idempotent (with side effects) 0001 Device idempotent (without side effects) 0010 Normal non-cacheable, non-bufferable 0011 Normal non-cacheable, bufferable 0100 ... 0111 Reserved 1000 Normal cacheable write back, no allocate, Reserved 1001 Normal cacheable write back, write allocate, Reserved for RMX-100/RMX-110-FS 1010 Normal cacheable write back, read allocate, Reserved for RMX-100/RMX-110-FS 1011 Normal cacheable write back, read and write allocate, Reserved for RMX-100/RMX-110-FS 1100 ... 1110 Reserved 1111 Empty region. Any attempt to access this region raises a synchronous trap

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: PMA_ADDR0
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: PMA_ADDR0 Register. PMA address registers encode both the base address and the NAPOT (Naturally Aligned Power of Two) size of one PMA region. A region of size 2R bytes, starting at address A, is encoded by placing 1s in bits [R-4:0], a 0 in bit [R-3], and when R < PALEN, the value (A >> R) is stored in bits [MXLEN-1:R]. As the minimum region size is 4 Kbytes, the minimum value of R is 12. The maximum value of R is PALEN, in this case A is 0 and no bits from A are stored in the PMA address register. These patterns are depicted in . Any PMA address register value for which R < 12 or R > PALEN is reserved. If a reserved value is written to a PMA address register the EN bit in the corresponding PMA entry will be cleared, and disable the PMA entry. defines the physical address length (PALEN bits), which depends on MXLEN and virtual memory. PMA Address Register Encoding PMA Address Registers Match Size (Bytes) yyyy...yyyyyyyyyyy Reserved ... Reserved yyyy...yy011111111 Reserved yyyy...y0111111111 212 (4 KBytes) yyyy...01111111111 213 (8 KBytes) ... yy01...11111111111 2XLEN y011...11111111111 2XLEN+1 0111...11111111111 Reserved yy01...11111111111 2XLEN(32) y011...11111111111 2XLEN+1(33) - Reserved 0111...11111111111 2XLEN+2(34) - Reserved 1111...11111111111 Reserved

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: MWDT_PASSWD
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: MWDT_PASSWD Register. Each Watchdog timer has a private set of indirectly addressable CSRs, which can be accessed by writing to the arcv_mwdt_passwd register with the correct password and required timer value in the TIMER_NUM field. If an incorrect password is written to the arcv_mwdt_passwd, then a watchdog timeout request is raised. If the value written to the TIMER_NUM field of the arcv_mwdt_passwd register is outside the range of implemented WDT timers, then any access to the (non-existent) indirectly addressable WDT CSRs results in an illegal instruction exception. The watchdog password register is used to allow access to all the registers for each timer. When the password register is written with the correct fields, it enables the software to program any one watchdog-related CSR (including arcv_mwdt_passwd) for the timer written in the TIMER_NUM field. After programming any one CSR (except arcv_mwdt_passwd), the writes to the CSRs are locked. Any write to the locked CSR (except arcv_mwdt_passwd) raises an illegal instruction exception. Any write to the password register, with an incorrect password (both PASSWORD and MST_PASSWORD) raises a watchdog timeout request. Reads from the arcv_mwdt_passwd register always return zero. Each timer can have a different unlock PASSWORD. When arcv_mwdt_passwd is locked: When arcv_mwdt_passwd is unlocked: The following flow chart describes the working of the arcv_mwdt_passwd register. Up to four watchdog timers can be configured per core. The software accesses these timers through the CSR interface of the WDT component. This comprises a set of three directly accessed CSRs: arcv_mwdt_build, arcv_mwdt_esr, arcv_mwdt_passwd and five indirectly accessed CSRs: arcv_mwdt_ctrl, arcv_mwdt_period, arcv_mwdt_lthresh, arcv_mwdt_uthresh, and arcv_mwdt_count. Write to the TIMER_NUM field with the correct password (both MST_PASSWORD and PASSWORD), update the selected watchdog timer and unlock all associated CSRs including arcv_mwdt_passwd itself. Write to the TIMER_NUM field with the correct MST_PASSWORD (no need to match the PASSWORD) and the RST bit set to 1, reset the timer indicated by TIMER_NUM and its CSRs to their default values which include the internal counter, timeout request, interrupt, and the PASSWORD. Write tothe MST_PASSWORD, TIMER_NUM, and RST fields has no effect. Write to the PASSWORD field with a new PASSWORD or the S_E bit, update the unlock password, or generate a software event for the timer indicated by TIMER_NUM respectively. arcv_mwdt_passwd Register Functionality Flowchart

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: S_E
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Used to raise a software event: When arcv_mwdt_passwd is locked, write to this field has no effect. When arcv_mwdt_passwd is unlocked, whether to enable the software event or not is specified as follows: 0x0: Ignored 0x1: Software event is raised and works for each mode as follows : Countdown timer mode ( arcv_mwdt_ctrl[4]=0x0): Write 1 with correct password automatically loads the value in the arcv_mwdt_period register to the internal counter. Window timer mode ( arcv_mwdt_ctrl[4]=0x1): Write 1 with correct password raises a software event (as opposed to hardware event) for validation of the internal counter against the upper and lower count limits.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: RST
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: When set, this bit specifies that all the writeable watchdog registers to be reset to default values and the timeout request to be cleared for the watchdog timer number specified in TIMER_NUM field. When arcv_mwdt_passwd is locked, writing 1 to this field resets the timer indicated by the TIMER_NUM field, only if the MST_PASSWORD is matching. If the MST_PASSWORD is not matching, then it will raise a timeout request. When arcv_mwdt_passwd is unlocked, write to this field has no effect.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: TN
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Specifies the number of the timers for which all the other fields in this register are applicable. When arcv_mwdt_passwd is locked, write the valid number of the timer to unlock this register (along with the correct PASSWORD and MST_PASSWORD). When arcv_mwdt_passwd is unlocked, write to this field has no effect.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: MST_PASSWORD
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Master password field to access the watchdog timer CSRs. This password is fixed to default value after reset. When arcv_mwdt_passwd is locked, write correct MST_PASSWORD (that is, the default value) to this field to unlock this register (along with the correct writes to the other fields) When arcv_mwdt_passwd is unlocked, write to this field has no effect.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: PASSWORD
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Password field to access the watchdog timer CSRs: When arcv_mwdt_passwd is locked, write correct PASSWORD to this field to unlock this register (along with the correct writes to the other fields) When arcv_mwdt_passwd is unlocked, write this field to update PASSWORD with a new value

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: MWDT_CTRL
ipxact:register.ipxact:description:
MWDT_CTRL Register. The watchdog control register is used to program a watchdog timer.
You must unlock this register before writing to it. You can unlock the register by writing the correct pass code to the arcv_mwdt_passwd register. Otherwise, an illegal instruction exception is raised. After a write, this register is locked

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: NH
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: This bit specifies whether to decrement the watchdog timer counter only when the processor is running or not

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: V0
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: Watchdog counts every cycle, when enabled

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: V1
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: Watchdog counts only when processor is not halted, when enabled

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: F
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Indicates a timeout error has occurred

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: V1
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: The watchdog timer counter has reached the value 0 , an illegal window event. Clearing this bit once it has been set resets the interrupt, reset or external time out signal Writing 1 to this field has no effect, and does not raise a timeout event. Writing 0 clears the timeout flag

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: EVENT
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Specifies the action of the watchdog timer when a time out error occurs:

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: V0
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: Assert a level interrupt. Writing the corresponding bit in the arcv_mwd t_esr clears the error (All watchdogs with this enabled combined. The status register needs to be read to determine which watchdog had a timeout and generated the interrupt).

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: V1
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: Assert (active high) external reset enable signal wdt_reset n . Writing the corresponding bit in the arcv_wdt_esr clears the error, if there are more than one timers. If there is a single timer, writing into F bit of this register clears the error.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: E
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Enables the watchdog timer (the internal counter begins decrementing)

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: MWDT_PERIOD
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: MWDT_PERIOD Register. The watchdog timer period register stores the initial value for the timer's internal counter. This register can store a 32-bit or a 16-bit period value. The width of this register is configured at build time. Any unused bits in this register are 0 (WARL). When this register is written, the internal counter of the selected timer is automatically loaded with the value. The internal counter is automatically loaded from the value in arcv_mwdt_period, when the S_E bit is set in arcv_mwdt_passwd. You must unlock this register before writing to it. You can unlock the register by writing the correct pass code to the arcv_mwdt_passwd register. Otherwise, an illegal instruction exception is raised. After a write, this register is locked.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: PERIOD
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: This bit stores the initial value for the timer's internal counter. This register can store a 32-bit or a 16-bit period value.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: MWDT_COUNT
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: MWDT_COUNT Register. When read, the arcv_mwdt_count register returns the current value of the internal counter for the selected WDT timer.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: COUNT
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: This returns the current value of the internal counter for the selected WDT timer.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: MWDT_LTHRESH
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: MWDT_LTHRESH Register. The lower threshold register stores the comparison value for the lower limit for the watchdog-timer window mode feature. This register can store a 32-bit or 16-bit threshold value. The width of this register is configured at build time. Any unused bits in this register always read as zeros. The value of this register when programmed must be less than the value stored in arcv_mwdt_uthresh. You must unlock this register before writing to it. You can unlock the register by writing the correct pass code to the arcv_mwdt_passwd register. Otherwise, an illegal instruction exception is raised. After a write, the register is immediately locked. Attempts to write to this register without unlocking it first, results in an illegal instruction trap.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: LOWERTHRESHOLD
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: The lower threshold register stores the comparison value for the lower limit for the enhanced watchdog-timer window mode feature.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: MWDT_UTHRESH
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: MWDT_UTHRESH Register. The upper threshold register stores the comparison value for the upper limit for the watchdog-timer window mode feature. This register can store a 32-bit or 16-bit threshold value. The width of this register is configured at build time. Any unused bits in this register always read as zeros. The value of this register when programmed must be greater than the value stored in arcv_mwdt_lthresh and less than the arcv_mwdt_count value when programmed. You must unlock this register before writing to it. You can unlock the register by writing the correct pass code to the arcv_mwdt_passwd register. After a write, the register is immediately locked. Attempts to write to this register without unlocking it first, results in an illegal instruction trap.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: UPPERTHRESHOLD
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: The upper threshold register stores the comparison value for the upper limit for the enhanced watchdog-timer window mode feature.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: ARCV_MWDT_BUILD
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: ARCV_MWDT_BUILD Register. The register describes the watchdog timer configuration.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: C
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Indicates if WDT supports an external clock source:

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: FREQ
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: When an external clock source is supported, the Freq field contains the frequency specified by the -watchdog_clk_freq option, in Hz, divided by 10 raised to the power of the Scale field.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: SCALE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: When an external clock source is supported, the Scale field is a power-of-ten scaling factor of the Freq field, and with values in the range 0..7 it is capable of scaling by factors of 1, 10, 100, ... , 10,000,000 .

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: SIZES
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Sizes is a 4-bit vector, with 1 bit for each WDT counter, to indicate whether it is 16 or 32 bits in size. The encoding of each bit is:

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: NT
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Number of timers implemented, encoded as an unsigned 3-bit integer. Supported values are 1,2,3, or 4, encoded as follows:

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: V3
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: 4 watchdog timers This field contains the value of the -watchdog_num option

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: VERSION
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: This is the version number of this WDT implementation (always non-zero if WDT is included)

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: MSFTY_PASSWD
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: MSFTY_PASSWD Register. This register shall be written with a 0x2 before a write to other safety registers is allowed. This register defaults back to 0x1 after the write to the safety password register is completed. Writes to safety registers without the preceding PASSWD write, are treated as an illegal instruction and trigger the regular illegal instruction exception. Reads from safety registers do not need to be preceded by a PASSWD write. Once the PASSWD is written, the PASSWD remains active until a safety register is written. That is, even if program flow is preempted between the PASSWD write and the safety register write due to an interrupt, the safety register can be written on returning from the ISR. The password writes and subsequent safety register writes are not considered atomic operations. This register protects write access for the following registers: arcv_msfty_ctrl arcv_msfty_diag arcv_msfty_shadow_ctrl

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: PWD
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: This describes status bits reflect safety password status:

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: MSFTY_CTRL
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: MSFTY_CTRL Register. This register defines the core safety control fields. As there are two cores (DCLS: Main, Shadow), the safety controller enables lockstep comparisons when the arcv_msfty_ctrl bits; [1:0] from both cores are set to 0x2 and, when the core comes out of reset and has reached a known state. Once bits [1:0] are set to 0x1 by either core, it takes up to two cycles (in case of DCLS time diversity of two) for the safety controller to disable error propagation. The safety errors are disabled until the lockstep mode is set. LSE/LSS Bit Definition LSE LSS Lockstep Mode 0x1 0x1 Disabled 0x1 0x2 Illegal or transition to lockstep disable mode 0x2 0x1 Disabled 0x2 0x2 Enabled To detect errors, the core should poll bits [3:2] (LSS: main/shadow instance are in lockstep) to verify that enable/disable is acknowledged by the safety controller. If bit [3:2] is not set or cleared because of bits [1:0] being updated in five cycles (maximum), an error has occurred. Bits[29:28] reflect the status of the external Hybrid Mode pins. If this configuration option is not selected, these bits default to 0x1 . Values of 0x0 and 0x3 are illegal and trigger a parity error. Bits[31:30] reflect the debug isolation status (controlled from external inputs). The lists the NSI bits debug isolation statuses. Debug Isolation (NSI) NSI Bit Debug Status 0x0 Illegal 0x1 Isolation disabled 0x2 Debug isolated 0x3 Illegal

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: LSS
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: This field indicates the status of lockstep comparison values:

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: LSE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: This field indicates values to enable or disable the lockstep comparison:

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: MSFTY_DIAG
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: MSFTY_DIAG Register. This is a dual-rail diagnostic error injection control register for latent checks. Injection on multiple mechanisms can be initiated in parallel. Error Injection complete will be set when all injection sequences are complete. Error injection on Safety Monitor aggregators (SMI) should not run in parallel with other safety mechanisms error injection.. RAS CSR must run memory ECC diagnosis error injection sequence by setting arcv_msfty_diag.MEI field to 0x2 to mask the error without reporting to the top-level error indicator during diagnosis error injection. After the error injection is done, software must again program this field to 0x1 to unmask and continue reporting truth memory ECC error to top-level error indicator.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: DI
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Error injection start indicator. Works in conjunction with other injection bits being set.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: CLF
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Clear Latent Fault. Software reset to clear latent check failure indicator

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: V2
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: Indicates Clears latent fault failure. This defaults back to 0x1 on the next cycle

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: V2
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: Start injection. DI bits must be set for injection to start

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: WEI
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Watchdog Timer error injection on parity decoders. (Exist if ASIL-B: -cpu_safety = 1 or 3)

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: V2
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: Start injection. DI bits must be set for injection to start

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: SMI
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Safety Monitor Error Injection on error aggregators.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: V2
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: Start injection. DI bits must be set for injection to start

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: MEI
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Memory Error Injection on error aggregators.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: V2
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: Start injection. DI bits must be set for injection to start

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: LR
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Lock Reset. Software reset to clear of sticky alarms.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: V2
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: Clears the safety alarm. These bits default to 0x1 on the next cycle.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: MSFTY_STL_CTRL
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: MSFTY_STL_CTRL Register. This register reflects the STL error.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: MSFTY_SHADOW_CTRL
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: MSFTY_SHADOW_CTRL Register. This register controls clock gating of the shadow copy of the lockstep core.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: SH
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: This field controls clock gating of the shadow core and it is implemented with TMR TMR represents Triple Modular Redundancy. logic:

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: MSFTY_ERROR_STATUS
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: MSFTY_ERROR_STATUS Register. This register provides error status of all the components. The register is only updated on a read request. This register also reports errors in the diagnostic modes.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: SBO
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Aggregated SBE syndrome register overflow indicator

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: TRE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Transient error indicator (EDC/Parity register protection error)

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: WDP
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Indicator of parity error on watchdog register

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: MAE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Aggregated address error on memory read

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: TSELECT
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: TSELECT Register. This register selects the trigger whose data should be connected to other trigger registers. An attempt to write a value which is greater than the index of the last trigger, resets the value of this register to the index of the last trigger. Debugger must restore the value of this register before resuming the execution because this register may be used by the target program when debug mode is entered.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: TDATA1
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: TDATA1 Register. This register controls the operating mode of the selected trigger and its base parameters. Other parameters can be specified through tdata2 and tdata3 registers, if required.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: V0
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: There is no trigger at this tselect value.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: V6
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: This trigger is an address/data match trigger. The remaining bits are described in mcontrol6 register.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: VHF
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: This trigger may operate in a different mode (for example, 6 or 7), but currently it does nothing and is in disabled state. Debugger may enable this trigger by replacing 15 with one of the supported types.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: DMODE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: If tdata1.type is 0, then this bit is hard-wired to 0.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: V0
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: Both, debug and M-mode can write the tdata registers at the selected tselect.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: V1
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: Only debug Mode can write the tdata registers at the selected tselect. Writes from other modes are ignored.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: DATA
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: This stores trigger-specific data. If tdata1.type is 0, then this field is hard-wired to 0.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: TDATA2
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: TDATA2 Register. This register provides trigger-specific data.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: TINFO
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: TINFO Register. This register provides the information about trigger types supported by the selected trigger.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: VERSION
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Contains the version of the Sdtrig extension implemented.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: V1
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: Supports triggers as described in the ratified version 1.0.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: INFO
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: One bit for each possible tdata1.type enumerated in tdata1. Bit N corresponds to type N. If the bit is set, then that type is supported by the currently selected trigger. If the currently selected trigger doesn't exist, this field contains 1.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: ARCV_MHPMEVENTINDEX
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: ARCV_MHPMEVENTINDEX Register. The register selects the event whose name should be shown by arcv_mhpmeventname0 to arcv_mhpmeventname3 registers.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: ARCV_MCOUNTERINTEN
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: ARCV_MCOUNTERINTEN Register. The N-th bit of this register indicates whether N-th counter should trigger an interrupt on overflow.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: ARCV_MCOUNTERINTACT
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: ARCV_MCOUNTERINTACT Register. The N-th bit of this register indicates that N-th counter has overflown and triggered the performance counter overflow interrupt. The performance counter interrupt remains pending until all bits of arcv_mcounterintact register are cleared.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: ARCV_MHPMEVENTNAME0
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: ARCV_MHPMEVENTNAME0 Register. If there is no countable event whose index is equal to arcv_mhpmeventindex value, then this register contains 0. Otherwise, it contains ASCII symbols 1-4 of the event name.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: ARCV_MHPMEVENTNAME1
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: ARCV_MHPMEVENTNAME1 Register. If there is no countable event whose index is equal to arcv_mhpmeventindex value, then this register contains 0. Otherwise, it contains ASCII symbols 5-8 of the event name.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: ARCV_MHPMEVENTNAME2
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: ARCV_MHPMEVENTNAME2 Register. If there is no countable event whose index is equal to arcv_mhpmeventindex value, then this register contains 0. Otherwise, it contains ASCII symbols 9-12 of the event name.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: ARCV_MHPMEVENTNAME3
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: ARCV_MHPMEVENTNAME3 Register. If there is no countable event whose index is equal toarcv_mhpmeventindexvalue, then this register contains 0. Otherwise, it contains ASCII symbols 13-16 of the event name.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: ARCV_HPM_BUILD
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: ARCV_HPM_BUILD Register. This register describes the configuration of the performance monitor. The register is readable even if hardware performance monitor is not present in the current configuration. In this case, the value of this register is 0.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: C
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: The number of available configurable counters.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: I
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Indicates the ability of the HPM logic to generate an interrupt on counter overflow.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: MMIO_SFTY_ERROR_STATUS
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: MMIO Safety Error Status Register. This register is a duplicate of arcv_msfty_error_status register. This is the error status register for diagnosis of external error control unit.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: SBO
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Aggregated SBE syndrome register overflow indicator

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: TRE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Transient error indicator (EDC/Parity register protection error)

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: WDP
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Indicator of parity error on watchdog register

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: MAE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Aggregated address error on memory read

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: MMIO_SFTY_LATENT_ERROR_STATUS
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: MMIO Safety Latent Error Status Register. When executing hardware error injection, latent error asserts top level error signal and record in the arcv_msfty_error_status.LF bit and mmio_sfty_error_status.LF bit. The failed safety mechanism that causes the latent error is recorded in mmio_sfty_latent_error_status register.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: SMF
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Safety monitor error injection failure indicator

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: MMIO_SFTY_STATUS
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: MMIO Safety Status Register. This is the status register for safety.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: NSI
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: This field is status bits reflect safety isolation status

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: MMIO_SFTY_SBE_CNT
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: MMIO Safety SBE Count Register. This register counts the single bit ECC errors on each memory. Each SRAM implements a 4-bit SBE counter. When each SRAM SBE counter field reaches the maximum value (0xF ), the value is kept and no new single-bit error are counted. Software can write a 0 to clear this register. Values other than 0 are ignored. Access variation: RW = User read/write is privilege violation.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: MMIO_SFTY_ICCM_DBE_ADR_SYND
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: MMIO Safety ICCM DBE Address Syndrome Register. This register is used to record the syndrome and address of double bit ECC errors on ICCM. The repeated error on same address will not be recorded again. It will be cleared to all zero after read. There is be no overflow for DBE, it is treated as fatal event by safety monitor.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: VALID
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Indicates double bit ECC error reported on ICCM

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: SYNDROME
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Indicates recorded syndrome of the double bit ECC error on ICCM

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: ADDRESS
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Indicates recorded address of the double bit ECC error on ICCM

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: ADDRESS
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Indicates recorded address of the ADE error on ICCM
